availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Uriah W. Oldham (Oldham County, Kentucky, teacher, merchant, and soldier 9th KY Cav. (U.S.A.))

body.p: Oldham County, Kentucky, teacher, merchant, and soldier. Oldham County, Kentucky native. Son of James Oldham and Martha Oldham. Married to Mary J. Conway Oldham in Carroll County, Kentucky, on Nov. 10, 1859. Father of James B. Oldham and Mary C. Oldham. Teacher in Oldham County in 1850. Merchant in Oldham County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain and adjutant from August 1, 1862 to September 11, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Division No. 2, p. 118A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, p. 808.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, Westpoint, p. 104B.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #5500.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Carroll County Marriages, Film 000414689, p. 129.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 230 & 238.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934_, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application # 470812, Certificate #507333.
